Playing this game made my life suck less. Good game.

Прекрасная возможность размять мозги в целом и соображалку в частности.
Да, здесь всего порядка 6 цветов и да, здесь не бог весть какой сюжет (как по закрученности, так и по продолжительности), но если вы ищете хорошую головоломку - она перед вами. А GLaDOS, безусловно, порадует ваше чувство прекрасного... прекрасного юмора и сарказма.
В качестве некоторого минуса я бы лично выделила первые 10-12 уровней (из 19), которые на фоне последующих даже разогревом назвать сложно - настолько быстро их проскакиваешь. Зато каждый последующий занимает все то время, умноженное на n-ое число, где это самое n возрастает в арифметической, а то и в геометрической прогрессии.
Нестареющая классика, которая после каждой честно пройденной камеры (по крайней мере, из второй половины) заставляет гордиться собой, и это, в отличие от тортика, истина. Ну а безудержное веселье как оно есть начнется в головоломках и усложненных камерах. Не забудьте почаще бить себя по рукам в процессе, дабы не пытаться заглянуть во всяческие руководства, а также после прохождения каждой камеры для сохранения крайне оптимистичного настроя принимать позу ожидания распорядителя.
Советую проходить в таком порядке: сюжетное первое, сюжетное повторно (если хотите взять определенные ачивки), усложненная камера №<...>, головоломки для камеры №<...> - удобнее будет применять полученные на каждом этапе знания и приемы.
P. S. И да, с полом персонажа промашка вышла (возможно, что это ляп перевода), но единственное место, где это обратило на себя мое внимание - финал.

(this is an edit of an older review I wrote for this game, I just wanted to add more detail and some more of my thoughts.)

When I originally wrote this review in 2017, I described Portal as 'stunning' and 'breathtaking'. Does that still hold up? Yeah, it does. 

I love Portal and Portal 2 equally for different reasons. Portal 2 feels more cinematic and lively with its addition of new characters, environment, gameplay features, and a more upbeat soundtrack. Portal on the other hand is almost the opposite. Portal has a more chill setting with a dab of isolation and loneliness sprinkled throughout. One thing that incapsulates that feeling of isolation is the track "Self Esteem Fund" from the soundtrack -also my personal favorite track in the game-. Self Esteem Fund feels like a mix of hopelessness and peace, like finding respite during the apocalypse or rediscovering a place that was nostalgic to you in the past but it is now in a state of disrepair after said apocalypse, and seeing that Portal takes place in the Half-Life universe that feeling totally fits. 

Portal, just like Portal 2, is a really fun game. Whenever I'm not really in the mood to play something high adrenaline and action-packed like Half-Life or Garry's Mod, Portal or Portal 2 are usually my go-to games for that. There's a satisfying feeling that comes with landing an energy pellet into the catcher. There's also an invigorating feeling with jumping off a platform, into a portal at the bottom and flying out of another one. 

Portal doesn't have as much of a detailed story as Portal 2 but I'm okay with simplicity. To sum it up to the simplest from, the story is basically "Your in a science complex with tons of test chambers and a robot lady says you get cake when you finish all the tests.". The twist at the end is also good one. It'd certainly surprise players who went in blind, it didn't surprise me because I had spoiled myself prior to playing. 

To conclude the lengthy review, Portal is a fun experience that I'd totally recommend anyone to play.

This game is purely amazing. If you are a fan of puzzle like games and enjoy being challenged, this is a game for you. This takes a First Person Shooter style game and removes the constant combat element and leaves you alone to solve various (mind baffeling at times) escape puzzles.

Spoiler alert!

The cake is a lie!

Portal is a unique challenging puzzle game with a great storyline. You are a test subject in Aperture Science and your task is to solve puzzles for science by using an equipment named "Portal Gun" or whatever you call it. Puzzles isn't that much very hard on the story mode but Bonus maps are the challenging ones. 

Not to be greedy but the puzzle in the story mode is not that hard. If you love valve games and dislike puzzle-based games, still go for it. You are being left out by the others if you haven't even played this game yet. Playing games can enhance your IQ ( i think) and increase you intelligence on puzzle solving.

Gameplay: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
First levels are really easy but some of them are very tricky. If you get the hang of it, you will love how it goes on and on. Although i wish they had the option to increase the Field of View to increase the range of what can be seen of the screen.

Story: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
What i hate about portal is that it ended. Just kidding, The story is very great, Even though there aren't much characters or NPCs to interact with it. ( i won't spoil anything don't worry. )

Graphics: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Graphics looks great, Despite the game running on Source Engine. Not much to say about it. 

Music: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The soundtrack is VERY lovely and wonderful. Especially the ending credits song. N̶o̶w̶ ̶i̶m̶ ̶l̶i̶s̶t̶e̶n̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶a̶ ̶1̶0̶ ̶h̶o̶u̶r̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶p̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶i̶t

For my overall rate, I give it 10/10
Why?
Its portal. You think its just a Generic game with puzzles but its not like that. The story and the soundtrack made it one of the BEST puzzle games ever.

it is a fun old puzzle game

Portal uses a concept that's a bit hard to wrap your head around without actually seeing it in action. The only "weapon" you're given is a portal gun that can shoot a portal entrance with the right mouse button and a portal exit with the left mouse button. Once both portals have been placed, you can walk though the entrance and find yourself at the exit. Walk through the exit and you're back at the entrance. The portals can be shot across a distance but only on certain surfaces, which creates the puzzle atmosphere. You'll have to figure out how to get across chasms, up and over obstacles, and around automated turrets. The trick is that you can only have one entrance and one exit meaning sometimes you'll encounter several kinds of brain teasers on how to use the portals correctly, and in some cases, quickly and often. It'll make you think about which portal you're placing, the exact location of where it needs to go, and the timing of when portals need to be switched.

Length: Short, only about 2 hours (3 or 4 if its your first time playing)
Difficulty: Difficult the first couple of times playing, but after that you start to remember everything and it becomes easy (but still fun!)
Gameplay: Fun and trippy!
Story: Just play the game! Also look at the lore, pretty interesting and dark

Overall 8/10, must play for literally anyone who wants a fun puzzle game with a good story
